column1: Likino-Dulyovo (Russian: Ликино́-Дулёво) is a town in Orekhovo-Zuyevsky District of Moscow Oblast
column3: located 98 kilometers (61 mi) northeast of Moscow. Population: 31
column6: 203 (1989 Census).The village of Dulyovo has grown around the Dulyovo porcelain works. The urban-type settlement of Likino-Dulyovo was formed in 1930 by merging the settlements of Likino and Dulyovo. Town status was granted to it in 1937. One of the town products
column8: was universally known throughout the former Soviet Union.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated within Orekhovo-Zuyevsky District as the Town of Likino-Dulyovo. As a municipal division
column3: the Town of Likino-Dulyovo is incorporated within Orekhovo-Zuyevsky Municipal District as Likino-Dulyovo Urban Settlement.The town is home to the avant-garde porcelain factory workers' club designed by Konstantin Melnikov in 1930.
